entry.title: Basic Number Theory
entry.summary: Modular Arithmetic Division For every integer dividend n and divisor m ‚â† 0, there exists unique quotient q and remainder r such that. \[n = qm + r\] \[0 ‚â§ r < m\] If r is the remainder after dividing n by m, we write n mod m = r An example showing. \[if \quad n = 14 \quad \textrm{and} \quad m = 6\] \[q = 14 \:/ \:6 = 2 \quad and \quad \:r \:= \:14 \:\% \:6 \:= \:2\] ...
